alert.note: Alert for Guernsey; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 4:16PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL GUERNSEY AND NORTHEASTERN NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 415 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Byesville, or near Cambridge, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Cambridge, Byesville, Quaker City, Senecaville, Pleasant City, Lore City, Old Washington, Salesville, Batesville, and Seneca Lake Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 175 and 197. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 33 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
